data.author: Peter Summers

changelog.release_notes:
Default to showing weather rather than latitude and longitude.

Fixed a problem with reference locations that start with a space.
Another attempt to fix the display color options for Pebble 2.
Fix for the coloring code.
Sets the label to BPM when displaying heart rate.
Uses a larger font for the health units on Pebble Time 2.
Support for the larger screen on a Pebble Time 2.
Supports Pebble Round

Should display heart rate even when there's no valid data for earlier in the day.

Fixed the menu icon.

Uses Pebble's Clay configuration platform, which means that it not longer requires an Internet connection to be configured.

You may need to reset your color settings after this upgrade.
Has a Pebble 2 version that will display heart rate (I think, as I don't have one to test).
Tidied up the spacing around the health units display.
Avoids overflowing the top line display.

Improved GPS error handling.

Please note, the health data display is broken at the moment due to a problem with version 3.14 of the firmware.  Pebble are working on this.
Can now display any Pebble Health metric on the top line.

Invalidates the weather cache if you change the API key.
Shows what the health metric is displaying, e.g. "STEPS".
On Pebble Time and Round, the display on the top line can now be configured to display steps for the day instead of moon data.

Reduces the buffer size for messages because it was unnecessarily large.

Street address abbreviates North to N, South to S, West to W and East to E.
Timezone works properly on Aplite platform running timeline (SDK3).

Allows the use of a label with no coordinates or trailing string (e.g. "Home:") to set the reference point to the current location - this is updated if the label text is changed in the settings but not otherwise.

Sets the reference point to the current location when the watch is first run.

This version will accept a reference location latitude and/or longitude of the form "-34,54.43 144,45.43", which it will interpret as latitude -34 degrees and 54.43 minutes, longitude 144 degrees and 45.43 minutes. You can also put in two commas, which it interprets as separating degrees, minutes and seconds. There should be a space between the latitude and longitude, but not between the degrees, minutes and seconds.

If the reference location doesn't look like two numbers, it will be assumed to be a street address and passed to Google for conversion to coordinates - street addresses can therefore be entered for the reference location on the configuration screen.

data.description:
This watch face displays the following:

 - time zone
 - phase of the moon (0-29 days, 0=new, 14=full),
 - location of the moon (0-99 x ~15-minute intervals), or
 - any one of Pebble's health metrics such as steps, distance, active time, sleep, kcal burnt,
 - link status (! if lost), 
 - am/pm
 - battery (0-10), 
 - date, 
 - time, 
and one of
 - latitude, longitude and altitude;
 - distance and direction to a reference point, speed and heading, altitude;
 - street address;
 - weather with temperature, wind and humidity/rainfall; or
 - weather with temperature, air pressure and humidity/rainfall.

If you obtain and enter an API key for Weather Underground in the settings then it will use that instead of OpenWeatherMap.

These are updated every minute, five minutes or half-hour as per your settings, or triggered by a vigorous shake along the Y axis of the watch (6 to 12 o'clock).

The moon location should be accurate to a standard deviation of about five minutes - 0 corresponds to the moon on the opposite side of the earth and 50 to its being at its highest point in the sky.  

The reference location can be specified in degrees (e.g. -35.34532 124.45221), in degrees and minutes (e.g. -35,20.342 124,26.345), in degrees, minutes and seconds (e.g. -35,20,21 124,26,20) or as a street address that will be handed to Google to resolve.

The display is designed for people with poor eyesight or reading under low light.

If you make any enhancements to this, please send me a copy.  If you like it, please give it a heart.

latest_release.release_notes:
Default to showing weather rather than latitude and longitude.

Fixed a problem with reference locations that start with a space.

data.title: Moon, Health, Location and Weather Watch
